weekly_top_story.headline: CMS Launches Initiative to Verify Citizenship and Immigration Status for Medicaid and CHIP Enrollees
weekly_top_story.summary: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) launched a new initiative to verify the citizenship and immigration status of individuals enrolled in Medicaid and CHIP, signaling significant changes in eligibility verification that could impact enrollment and access to healthcare.
weekly_top_story.source: Alston & Bird Health Care Week in Review

stories.headline: FDA Rescinds Emergency Use Authorizations for COVID-19 Vaccines
stories.summary: The FDA officially revoked the remaining EUAs for COVID-19 vaccines, restricting broad access and recommending immunization only for individuals at higher risk of severe disease, while granting full marketing authorization for specific vaccines for certain age groups.

stories.headline: Congressional Debate Intensifies on 340B Drug Pricing Reforms and Medicare Advantage Payment Standards
stories.summary: Ongoing legislative discussions in Congress focus on reforming the 340B drug pricing program with a push towards a rebate system and advancing the Medicare Advantage Prompt Pay Act to ensure timely payments to healthcare providers, reflecting major policy changes with significant operational impacts.
stories.source: Paul Keckley Report / American Hospital Association News
